summary: The diff implements both REQ-1 (API Configuration modal dialog) and REQ-2 (backend persistence and pre-filling). The frontend ApiConfigDialog.tsx covers the modal overlay, centered white dialog ~500px wide, bold title, labeled text input for endpoint URL, password-masked API key input, gray-outline Cancel button, solid blue Save button, inline validation errors, loading state, and pre-filling from backend. The backend main.mo implements configureExternalApi and getExternalApiConfig with admin-only access control. The Header component shows the API Config button only to confirmed admin users. All major acceptance criteria appear to be addressed.

hallucinated_features.description: A migration module (backend/migration.mo) that converts old separate apiEndpoint/apiKey fields into a unified ExternalApiConfig object during canister upgrade.
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request does not mention implementing a data migration module or upgrading from an old schema. Migration logic was not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Clicking the semi-transparent backdrop closes the dialog when not saving.
hallucinated_features.reason: The spec does not mention that clicking the overlay should close the dialog; it only specifies a Cancel button with gray outline styling that closes the dialog without saving.

hallucinated_features.description: URL format validation for the API Endpoint URL field requiring a valid URL format.
hallucinated_features.reason: The spec requires inline validation errors for missing/invalid fields but does not explicitly specify URL format validation beyond requiring a non-empty value.
